column4: Hi. How to install Ubuntu when my CD-ROM cannot boot from CD? I tryed sbootmgr, but in the menu isn't CDROM to select.
Is any boot disket?
You can make a bootable floppy from one of the disk images on the cdrom which will boot to floppy then do the rest of the install from cd
You think Smart boot manager?
In your bios?
In BIOS I of course do boot from floppy.
and the computer has a cdrom but just cannot boot from cdrom?
Yes. BIOS is very old.
Yes, so there exists a floppy drive file which you create a boot floppy from. Then you boot to this floppy and continue from the cd after
I will find a suitable link for you to use
What OS is on the laptop right now?
Why? How to you know, then I have laptop? I have Ubuntu 6.06.
If you already have an ubuntu distribution then more practical to do a dist-upgrade than the smart boot manager method.
I want install ubuntu to other PC.
I got ghosted but am returned
to reiterate what may not have been sent:
OK, then the method would be to make the Smart Boot Manager floppy from http://btmgr.sourceforge.net/download.html and then continue the install from the cdrom
If you are interested in a netboot method and the box which you wish to install to has boot from network ability I can also help with that way
Thanks for interest. I will study your links and I will answer you maybe tomorow.
I shall be here at about the same hour as now
ok
